properties.areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Wind River Basin; Lander Foothills
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 1 at 6:35AM MST until February 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Major Winter Storm Possible Sunday Afternoon through Monday
Night...

.A cold front will pull south into northern Wyoming Sunday
morning. This cold front will surge southward to the Continental
Divide by around sunset Sunday, and then across southwest Wyoming
Sunday night. The precipitation is expected to occur in the wake
of the cold front, and could take a few hours after frontal
passage until the snow develops. This storm system will move
slowly, with snow lingering through Monday night. The heaviest
snowfall looks to occur Sunday night and Monday in most
locations. Snowfall amounts are preliminary and will likely change
as the storm track becomes more defined.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible.

* WHERE...Wind River Mountains, Wind River Basin, and Green
Mountains and Rattlesnake Range.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night.

* SNOW AMOUNTS...7 to 11 inches in the lower elevations, except 12
to 18 inches in the Lander Foothills. 16 to 24 inches on the
eastern slopes of the Wind River Mountains with 6 to 12 inches
on the western slopes. Locally higher amounts are possible.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecasted snow amounts will likely
change as the storm system gets closer and details become
clearer. This will likely be the heaviest snowfall since
Thanksgiving.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
People should prepare now for a drastic change to wintry and cold
conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
